test_code_analysis: These tests verify the behavior of the login endpoint in various scenarios, including successful login, invalid credentials, missing username or password, no data, and handling exceptions.

The tests verify the functionality of the LoginService's authenticate_user method, covering scenarios such as successful authentication, incorrect passwords, non-existent users, locked accounts, mixed-case usernames, numeric passwords, null usernames, empty usernames, and empty passwords.
The tests verify the login functionality of an account lock controller, covering scenarios including successful and unsuccessful logins, invalid and missing data in the login request.

The tests verify the login functionality of the account lockout controller, covering scenarios for successful login, locked account, invalid credentials, missing user ID, missing password, and empty payload.

The unit tests verify the authentication functionality of the AuthService. The main scenarios tested include successful authentication, failure due to invalid password, failure when the user is not found, and various edge cases such as empty or None inputs and SQL injection attempts.
